p: In this study, the results of mineral content of M. officinalis showed that it is a rich source of mineral compounds such as Ca (28,385 mg/kg), K (18,474.000 mg kg −1), Fe (1491.000 mg kg −1), Na (897.000 mg kg −1) and Zn (51.400 mg kg −1). Hence, it might be concluded and confirmed from this study that this plant would not only serve as a flavoring agent but also a good source of several essential mineral elements.
